channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple potholes on northbound inside of corner, 29th January
item.description:
There are multiple potholes on the left hand side of the northbound carriageway on the left hand (long sweeping) corner before you get to the turning for National Star. Please can this corner be resurfaced, as currently vehicles drive in the middle of the road on the way around the corner
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previously patched section of road sinking, 29th January
item.description:
There is a patch in the road which was previously repaired. It has sunken again and is causing cars to bottom out when driving across. The patch is approx 6x4ft wide
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Hewlett Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10 inch the full width of the road for those travelling into Churchdown., 28th January
item.description:
2 x craters - 1 you can just avoid - the other is on the bend in the road and this one you cannot avoid to not go down. They have had previous repairs but now large holes (for my small tyres) unavoidable as they cover the leftside of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path overgrown in hedge, 28th January
item.description:
Path through hedge on path between Cold Pool Lane and Badgeworth Lane at the junction with Brookfield Road is blocked by overgrowth.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: The traffic lights actual lights are not very visible until you are nearly under them, 28th January
item.description:
On approach to the traffic lights travelling towards Churchdown - traffic lights could be on green, amber or red - you are not aware until you are virtually underneath - terrible for drivers visibility and awareness
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Large pot holes through centre of the road, 28th January
item.description:
There are numerous reports of potholes further along the road but the issue stretches the entire road. It’s been the case for months and months and with every spell of cold weather it breaks down more. It shakes my entire car - I’m considering exchanging it for a dune buggy with these roads!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127, Caernarvon Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Outside 41 opposite side of road

item.title: Subsiding / broken tarmac next to a drain, 28th January
item.description:
Between Tesco and Pirton Lane traffic lights, southwest bound, a low drain (which I think may have been repaired in the last few months) has surrounding tarmac subsiding, and is creating a hard lip edge on the side facing traffic. Could it be checked and ideally repaired please ? Thanks !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Push box issue, 28th January
item.description:
Push button seems to be stuck pushed in on one of the pedestrian call points causing main traffic light to be on red more than they need to be
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Delta Way, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury

item.title: NUMEROUS DEEP POTHOLES FROM SEVEN SPRINGS ROUNDABOUT TO COTSWAY BARN. there is no response to the emergency line so to inform you I've reduced the size. there are in excess of 20., 28th January
item.description:
You filled in 30 + potholes between seven springs roundabout and Cotsway barn previously. 20 have re-emerged. Some are dangerously deep but there is no response to your emergency number. This has already cost me 2 tyres and 2 shock absorbers. They need repairing, preferably the road resurfacing as the repairs don't last more than 4 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Lane, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover banging loudly. Almost every vehicle drives over it. Surface around it recently repaired but this issue has not been fixed. Has been making a loud noise for several weeks and can be heard from 600m away 24/7., 28th January
item.description:
Cheltenham bound side of carriageway on A435.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: All lights in robins close have been out for well over a month, 28th January
item.description:
All lights in robins close have been out for well over a month,the close is mainly occupied by disabled & elderly residents who are finding this very unnerving
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-8, Robins Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parking right up to blind spot round from Birdlip to Brimpsfield, 27th January
item.description:
Going through Birdlip round to the bend towards Brimpsfield cars are parking right up to the corner. Lines are faded and going that way has potential to drive into car coming round the bend from Brimpsfield. It is more concerning due to the amount of traffic coming from Brimpsfield and number of larger vehicles. There is just no where to go and coming from Birdlip you have to commit to going through as no gaps to pull in. To be fair it has only been recently cars have parked there but every day the last few week ps in rush hour it has been a concern. I notice a similar issue around this area was reported but stating it’s closed so wanted to highlight it as it is such a blind bend and people drive fast around that corner. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Birdlip, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: My 89 year old father fell due to this pot hole. He was walking slowly and was very lucky not to be seriously hurt. It could have resulted in hospitalisation. He was dizzy afterwards as he has a weak heart. It is dangerous for any elderly people. My mum has had a hip replacement and has sight loss. They live locally and walk this route several times a week., 27th January
item.description:
In front of house called 'Kimberley' on Bradley Road, Charlton Kings. On left side of road walking towards Cirencester Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous parking, 27th January
item.description:
Car owners park their cars on the south side of Westfield Avenue despite having driveways that they could park on. This has the effect of forcing drivers on to the wrong side of the road as they are approaching the blind corner on this junction. People driving in the opposite direction, from Ermin Park onto Westfield Ave tend to take this corner at speed, only to be confronted with oncoming traffic on their side of the road. This has been an issue for 5+ years. Serious accident as a result in 2018 but no action taken. Double yellow lines needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westfield Avenue, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
